newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Astra says weaker crown to impact Q2.
newsitem.headline: Astra says weaker crown to impact Q2.

text.p: A weakening in the Swedish crown will start to impact drug company Astra's result in the second quarter of 1997, a company spokesman said on Wednesday.
"We will start to see the weakening of the crown take effect in the second, third quarter," spokesman Staffan Ternby told Reuters.
Astra had earlier posted a 10 percent rise in 1996 pre-tax profit to 13.22 billion crowns.
Ternby said Astra was "very well hedged" for six months ahead.
"We hedge about 80 percent of our currency exposure," Ternby said.
He said Astra was more dependent on the mark than the dollar.
"Less than a third of our total exposure is to the dollar," he said.
